title: BBC Local Live in Beds, Herts & Bucks on Monday 3 August - BBC News
summary: a controlled explosion has taken place in a field in bromham , following the discovery of a possible world war two explosive .
plans for a multi-million pound development in milton keynes will include a 100 berth marina and more than 300 new homes .
the luton to dunstable busway remains partially closed after an incident on saturday where three people were injured .
a lorry driver from hemel hempstead says the stress from the ongoing problem of illegal immigrants has forced him to quit his job .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on tuesday .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's all from us today on local live for beds , herts and bucks - we 'll be back with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for the area from 08:00 tomorrow .
if you 've missed us at all today , here 's a round-up of our top stories :

documents.title: luton to dunstable busway will reopen today
text: the luton to dunstable busway will be re-opened later today , luton borough council have said following an accident on saturday evening in which three people were injured .
a guided bus left the tracks near the skimpot roundabout and the busway has been closed between there and the white lion retail park since .

luton borough council say `` there is nothing at this stage to suggest any failure with the busway 's infrastructure '' but until more substantial repairs to the track can be made , buses will run through the section at a reduced speed .
from 17 august , the busway will be closed for five days to allow for curing of new concrete .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: weather : mostly dry weather tomorrow
text: it 's a rather cloudy end to the day , with perhaps the odd light shower possible .
it should be dry overnight , with some good clear spells developing .
minimum temperature : 11c ( 52f ) .
it should be mostly dry tomorrow , with plenty of sunshine to start , but cloud will build up during the day with perhaps the odd shower developing by the afternoon in the west towards dunstable .
it will also be breezy and feel cooler with a maximum temperature of 21c ( 70f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: mk council 'disappointed ' badminton england plans dropped
text: plans to develop a purpose built badminton arena in milton keynes have been scrapped due to lack of funding .
badminton england had hoped it would create one of the best badminton training centres in the world , but they have now decided it 's no longer feasible at the national bowl .
the leader of milton keynes council , pete marland told
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: the mighty cardington hangars
text: you may have been wondering what our main image is today at the top of our live page
well , this grand photo , courtesy of john o'reilly , shows the humongous cardington hangars in bedfordshire .
they are home to hybrid air vehicles , the company behind the world 's largest airship .
i 'd love to see your images of places in the three counties , you can get in touch
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: bearded dragons home half destroyed by fire
text: i 've just spoken to buckinghamshire and milton keynes fire and rescue service who 've told me a little bit more about the incident involving the bearded dragon
the first the family in aylesbury knew of any problem was that their fire alarm was going-off , but they did n't actually realise what was wrong .
when firefighters arrived , they noticed the reptile tank was filled with smoke and beginning to leak out into the bedroom .
the bearded dragon was quickly retrieved and put into a plastic kitchen bin with the lid on and an oxygen tube inside .
after 10 minutes , he looked much perkier and seemed to be doing well when firefighters left .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: controlled explosion complete in bromham
text: the detonation of a suspected world war two explosive has taken place in a field in bromham , bedfordshire , this afternoon .
police are advising residents that they can now return home and that pcsos will stay on the scene to reassure people .
the device was found shortly after 11:00 in a garden on village road .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: the news this evening
text: the top stories we 're looking at this evening :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: barton-le-clay house owner loses appeal
text: a bedfordshire man who built a house in barton-le-clay without planning permission has lost his latest appeal against the ruling .
it 's a long running dispute which started in april 2012 when businessman syed shah was given permission to
mr shah appealed and won .
the council challenged that decision and it went back to the planning inspectorate .
they 've now found in favour of central bedfordshire council , agreeing that it is inappropriate development in the green belt .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: more than 60 kittens dumped at stevenage vets
text: staying with animals a vets in stevenage has had more than 60 kittens dumped outside their premises over the last few years and suspect they may be coming from the same person .
walton lodge veterinary clinic has had 10 litters left outside , the latest being a litter of six kittens who are now in the care of
the cats , always black and white or tabby , are normally left in a new carrier .
this time they were all suffering from cat flu .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: bearded dragon rescued from fire
text: firefighters in buckinghamshire have rescued a bearded dragon in aylesbury this afternoon after a fire in its reptile tank .
the heat lamp for the tank dropped onto the sawdust covering the tank floor , causing a small fire .
oxygen was given to the bearded dragon (
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: milton keynes multi-million pound development plans
text: plans for a multi-million pound , 15 acre development of the campbell park area of milton keynes will include a 100-berth marina and more than 300 new homes .
the plans have been drawn up by
developer crest nicholson are proposing a mixed-use development which will include a local convenience store , a cafe , restaurant , nursery and pub .
the marina is intended to form the start of the proposed bedford to milton keynes canal link .
the plans will now go out for consultation .
author: Carol Abercrombie
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: luton council working with arriva over accident
text: luton borough council are working with arriva to investigate how one of the company 's buses was derailed on the luton to dunstable busway on saturday night .
the bus left the tracks near the skimpot roundabout and three people were injured - the driver and two passengers .
until repairs can be carried out , the busway remains closed between skimpot and the white lion retail park .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: lynda bellingham plaque to be unveiled today
text: a plaque to commemorate the life of the late actress lynda bellingham is to be unveiled in buckinghamshire today .
it 's being put on the promenade at aylesbury 's waterside theatre which leads to the venue 's second space which is being named after the star .
she died in october last year at the age of 66 .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: wakeboarder 's record attempt for charity
text: a wakeboarder from bedfordshire is attempting a world record this week to raise money for cancer research uk .

james gray , 24 , from ampthill , whose father has terminal cancer , will try to enter the guinness world record on friday for the longest continuous wakeboard - the record is currently set at six hours and 42 minutes .
`` i decided to attempt this feat when my dad was diagnosed with terminal cancer .
he is currently undergoing treatment '' , said james .
he will make the record attempt at box end park lake in kempston .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: the news so far this afternoon
text: the top stories this afternoon :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: picture of the scene in bromham
text: this is what the scene in bromham , bedfordshire , looks like this afternoon following the discovery of a possible world war two explosive device .
the device was found shortly after 11:00 and a controlled explosion is due to take place soon .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: controlled explosion to take place in bromham
text: a controlled explosion is due to take place shortly in a field in bromham , following the discovery of a possible world war two explosive .
the detonation is being carried out by explosive ordnance disposal officers following the discovery of a device in a garden in village road shortly after 11:00 .
police ask members of the public not to be alarmed .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: roads closed in bromham after wwii explosive discovery
text: i 've just had confirmation from bedfordshire police that a possible world war two explosive device has been discovered in bromham .
police received reports just after 11:00 after a sus device was found in a garden in village road .
roads closures are in place including stagsden road , molivers lane , grange lane and village road .
explosive ordnance disposal officers have been informed .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: state of the art badminton facility abandoned
text: badminton england have revealed that it will not pursue plans for its national arena development in milton keynes .
the state-of-the-art , world class training and community sports facility , was set to be built at the national bowl , moving badminton england from it 's current site in loughton .

the development would have been a venue for elite badminton , for local community use and would have attracted a host of european and international major events , not just in badminton , but across a range of sports .
author: Luke Ashmead
BBC Three Counties Radio sport

documents.title: reports of wwii explosive found in bromham
text: we 're getting reports that a world war two explosive has been found in an out-building in the bedfordshire village of bromham .
stephen has emailed to say that police have advised residents to stay indoors and away from windows .
i 've spoken to bedfordshire police who are getting back to me with more information .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: mcdonald 's window broken during fight

documents.title: teddy sheringham in football league managers xi
text: teddy sheringham may be new to management , but his playing skills have earned him a place in bbc sport 's
the former manchester united number 10 , who will start his competitive managerial career for stevenage on saturday , is paired with dean saunders in the side , supporting jimmy floyd hasselbaink .
the fictitious side is led by ipswich manager mick mccarthy , who sheringham will go head-to-head with next tuesday in the capital one cup .
author: Richard Haugh
BBC News

documents.title: badminton england scraps plans to move to national bowl
text: the organisation had been planning to move to a new national headquarters since 2012 , with the centre comprising of 17 courts , a 3,000-seat arena , fitness club and athlete accommodation .

in a statement , badminton england said they had explored numerous options and `` it became clear that each of them would have posed a major concern to the ongoing viability of the facility and more importantly placed the financial sustainability of badminton england at considerable risk . ''
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: woman attacked at ub40 concert in bedford
text: a woman has suffered head injuries being attacked by a group of people at the ub40 concert in bedford park yesterday .
the incident happened about 22:45 and the main offender is described as a white woman with a blonde bob .
she was tanned , thin and wearing denim shorts .
she was with a group of men .
police have described the attack as `` nasty '' and `` unprovoked '' .
they are appealing for witnesses .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: aylesbury waterside pay tribute to cilla black
text: aylesbury waterside theatre in buckinghamshire has also
the theatre
they were `` honoured to have welcomed her '' at their opening and as the star of their first pantomime , cinderella , in 2010 .
truly saddened to hear the news on cilla black .
honoured to have welcomed her at our opening & as star of our 1st panto in 2010 # greatloss
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

text: it will be a rather cloudy afternoon with the chance of a few , mostly light showers .
it will feel warm , however , especially in any sunnier breaks to do develop .
maximum temperature : 24c ( 75f ) .

documents.title: lunchtime travel update
text: the m25 is slow anticlockwise between j21 and j16 because of an earlier broken down vehicle .
there 's disruption on the a507 in both directions in stotfold between hitchin road and stotfold road because of temporary traffic lights .
traffic 's queuing on the a41 in buckinghamshire through the roadworks between the high street and creighton road .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: if you 're just catching up
text: top stories this lunchtime :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: seven reported missing in bedfordshire every day
text: on average , about seven people each day are reported missing in bedfordshire and the police say it 's putting a strain on it 's time and resources .

det supt sharn basra from bedfordshire police says it 's about trying to assess how serious the situation is : `` we 've got to make sure at that first point of contact the risk is evaluated to make sure the right people are dealing with this issue .
`` if the person thinks my child , or my friend , or my parent is not where they should be - they 'll probably go through 101 .
if they are genuinely concerned and there is immediate risk , i would always suggest 999 . ''
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: luton town 's new shirt sponsor
text: luton town football club has announced that barnfield college in the town is the club 's new shirt sponsor .
the college 's name will replace former sponsor easyjet from the start of the new season .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: driver and two passengers injured on busway
text: the luton to dunstable busway will remain closed between skimpot road and the white lion retail park `` until minor repairs can be carried out '' , the arriva bus company say .
a spokeswoman for arriva has confirmed that one of the company 's buses was involved in an incident near the skimpot roundabout on the busway on saturday evening .
the driver and two passengers were injured .
an investigation is underway to determine the cause of the accident .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: 94-year-old pedestrian seriously injured in crash
text: a 94-year-old man has been seriously injured after being knocked down on the a41 bicester road in aylesbury , outside the bp petrol station .
the pedestrian has been taken to the stoke mandeville hospital with a broken arm and head injuries where he remains in a serious condition .
the driver of the blue rover was n't injured in the collision .
police are appealing for witnesses to the accident which happened shortly after midday on saturday .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: milton keynes library given grade ii listing
text: milton keynes central library is being listed as a historic building .
it 's
the library , built between 1979 and 1981 , has been listed at grade ii by the heritage minister tracey crouch .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: lorry driver quits job because of calais stress
text: a lorry driver from hemel hempstead says the stress from the ongoing problem of illegal immigrants has forced him to quit his job .
`` i 've had enough '' , jim barker told
`` i was continually worrying about the state of the traffic , the queuing you have people climbing over your vehicle , pushing the mirrors in , banging on the doors .
it 's just diabolical over there ''
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: cilla black book of condolence opened
text: a book of condolence is being opened in liverpool for cilla black , who 's died at the age of 72 .
stars from the world of show business have been paying tribute to the entertainer who lived in buckinghamshire .
what are your memories of the star ?
join the conversation over on
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: roads looking slightly congested
text: on the m1 southbound between j10 and j9 there is heavy traffic .
there is slow traffic on the a120 in hertfordshire between the puckeridge roundabout and bishops park way in bishop 's stortford .
check your route before you travel
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: missing people 'strain ' on police
text: tracking down missing people is becoming a strain on time and resources , bedfordshire police says .
it follows comments by the chief constable of greater manchester police , who recently said it had become an `` unsustainable burden '' .
on average seven people a day are reported missing in bedfordshire .
police and crime commisioner olly martins said he would like to explore whether other agencies , such as the fire brigade or social workers , could help out .
author: David Keller
BBC News Online

documents.title: people hurt after busway puncture
text: we 've just been told that three people were injured over the weekend when a guided bus left the luton-dunstable busway after getting a punctured tyre .
it happened shortly before 23:00 on saturday in skimpot road ,
thanks to jon coomber for sending in this photo - we 're contacting police to find out some more about what happened .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: weather : sunny with a chance of showers
text: today there will be some sunny spells , especially at first , but generally rather cloudy through the day with a chance of a few , mostly light showers .
it will feel warm , especially in the sunnier breaks .
maximum temperature : 24c ( 75f ) .
tonight it will be rather cloudy at first with perhaps the odd shower towards the east of hertfordshire , before turning dry .
minimum temperature : 11c ( 52f ) .

documents.title: boat explosion injures seven people
text: in case you missed it late yesterday - seven people , including two children , have been
it happened at bray lock , amerden lane , taplow , close to the berkshire border , at around lunchtime on sunday .
two men and a woman , in their 40s , a woman in her 30s , a teenage girl and a three-year-old boy were taken to hospital with non life-threatening injures .
another man was treated at the scene .
we 'll bring you more on what caused the explosion when we have it .
author: David Keller
BBC News Online
